title: Notices
description: Various notice cases, their contents, importance, and durations

flashcards.question: When signing on what notice cases must you check and why?
flashcards.answer: Roster notice case - to check you are on the right job and to see if your job has AW and your next shift. Late notice case - to check for any speed restrictions, ice mode, and safety of the line notices. Train crew notice case - to check for any traction notices or any notices moved from late notice case and any no safety of the line notices. Incident notice case - to check on any latest operational incidents. Low adhesion notice case to check colour and areas treated by RHTT.

flashcards.question: What information would you find in the late notice case?
flashcards.answer: Emergency speed restrictions, ice mode activation any other safety of the line notices e.g. colour of low adhesion day, register.

flashcards.question: How long will a notice be posted in late notice case?
flashcards.answer: Posted for 72hrs (ESR's can be re-issued or entered in WON then they become TSR's).

flashcards.question: What information would you find in the train crew notice case?
flashcards.answer: Notices moved from late notice case, Traction notices, any other non safety of the line notices, register.

flashcards.question: How long will the notice be posted in the train crew notice case?
What information would you find in the incident notice case?
flashcards.answer: Recent operational incidents, list of multi SPAD signals, register.

flashcards.question: How long will a notice be posted in the incident notice case?
flashcards.answer: 4 weeks, multi SPAD signal list stays in there permanently.

flashcards.question: What information would you find in the health and safety notice case?
flashcards.answer: First aid arrangements, authorised walking routes, H&S policy statement, care first policy, phone numbers.

flashcards.question: How long will a notice be posted in the health and safety notice case?
flashcards.answer: Stays in permanently or until updated.

flashcards.question: What is the purpose of the register in notice cases?
flashcards.answer: The register records which notices have been posted and when they were added or removed from the notice case.

flashcards.question: What does ESR stand for?
flashcards.answer: Emergency Speed Restriction - found in the late notice case.

flashcards.question: What does TSR stand for?
flashcards.answer: Temporary Speed Restriction - once an ESR is entered in the WON it becomes a TSR.

flashcards.question: What is a Multi SPAD signal?
flashcards.answer: A signal that has been passed at danger more than once and is listed permanently in the incident notice case.

flashcards.question: What is the low adhesion notice case used for?
flashcards.answer: To check the current color status for low adhesion and areas treated by Rail Head Treatment Trains (RHTT).

flashcards.question: What does RHTT stand for in the low adhesion notice case?
flashcards.answer: Rail Head Treatment Train - used to treat areas of low adhesion on the track.

flashcards.question: What does AW stand for in the roster notice case?
flashcards.answer: Altered Working - indicates that there are changes to your scheduled work.
